record.name: NO_ERROR
record.description: No error

record.name: WRONG_IF
record.description: Mtrace2 Request arrived on an interface to which this router would not forward for the specified group towards the source or RP.

record.name: PRUNE_SENT
record.description: This router has sent a prune upstream which applies to the source and group in the Mtrace2 Request.

record.name: PRUNE_RCVD
record.description: This router has stopped forwarding for this source and group in response to a request from the downstream router.

record.name: SCOPED
record.description: The group is subject to administrative scoping at this router.

record.name: NO_ROUTE
record.description: This router has no route for the source or group and no way to determine a potential route.

record.name: WRONG_LAST_HOP
record.description: This router is not the proper LHR.

record.name: NOT_FORWARDING
record.description: This router is not forwarding this source and group out the outgoing interface for an unspecified reason.

record.name: REACHED_RP
record.description: Reached the Rendezvous Point.

record.name: RPF_IF
record.description: Mtrace2 Request arrived on the expected RPF interface for this source and group.

record.name: NO_MULTICAST
record.description: Mtrace2 Request arrived on an interface which is not enabled for multicast.

record.name: INFO_HIDDEN
record.description: One or more hops have been hidden from this trace.

record.name: REACHED_GW
record.description: Mtrace2 Request arrived on a gateway (e.g., a NAT or firewall) that hides the information between this router and the Mtrace2 client.

record.name: UNKNOWN_QUERY
record.description: A non-transitive Extended Query Type was received by a router which does not support the type.

record.name: FATAL_ERROR
record.description: A fatal error is one where the router may know the upstream router but cannot forward the message to it.

record.name: NO_SPACE
record.description: There was not enough room to insert another Standard Response Block in the packet.

record.name: ADMIN_PROHIB
record.description: Mtrace2 is administratively prohibited.
Reserved
Mtrace2 Query
Mtrace2 Request
Mtrace2 Reply
Mtrace2 Standard Response Block
Mtrace2 Augmented Response Block
Mtrace2 Extended Query Block
Unassigned
